
# Computing Environment {#sec-appendix-d}

All the computations were done in **R**
[@rcoreteamLanguageEnvironmentStatistical2024]
with the help of several packages in the areas
of computation, data sets, and graphics/tables.
Readers wishing to replicate the results shown should 
install the following packages (and their
dependencies).
All but one of them are available from
[*The Comprehensive R Archive Network*](https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html)
(CRAN).

## Computation

We have used the following packages in our computations

| Package Name | Citation |
|:-------------|:-------------|
| `actuar`     | @dutangActuarPackageActuarial2008 |
| `dhglm`      | @leeDhglmDoubleHierarchical2018 |
| `gamlss`     | @rigbyGeneralizedAdditiveModels2005 |
| `hglm`       | @ronnegardHglmPackageFitting2010 |
| `lme4`       | @batesFittingLinearMixedeffects2015 |
| `MASS`       | @venablesModernAppliedStatistics2002 |
| `mvtnorm`    | @genzComputationMultivariateNormal2009 |
| `statmod`    | @dunnRandomizedQuantileResiduals1996 |
| `tidyverse`  | @wickhamWelcomeTidyverse2019 |

: R packages used in computations.

## Data 

The following packages, available on CRAN,
have data sets used in the text.

| Package Name    | Citation                           |
|:----------------|:-----------------------------------|
| `GLMsData`      | Peter K. Dunn and Smyth (2022)     |
| `insuranceData` | Wolnyâ€“Dominiak and Trzesiok (2014) |
| `lars`          | Hastie and Efron (2022)            |
| `mdhglm`        | Youngjo Lee, Molas, and Noh (2018) |

: R packages with data sets used in the text.


The `CASdatasets` package is not available on the
*Comprehensive R Archive Network* due to its size.
Please visit the 
[CASdatasets](https://github.com/dutangc/CASdatasets) 
page on 
[GitHub](https://github.com/) 
for further information and instructions on how to install it.


The data sets `bus-case.csv` and `medpar.csv` are not
available from CRAN. Both of them are avilable from their
corresponding book:

1. *Non-Life Insurance Pricing with  Generalized Linear Models* 
   [@ohlssonNonlifeInsurancePricing2010] is the source of the 
   data set `bus-case.csv`, and 
1. *Negative Binomial Regression*
   [@hilbeNegativeBinomialRegression2007] provides the 
   `medpar.csv` data set.
